results.title: The Orchard, timber yard, Oakbank farm
results.creator_credit: James Mann, Chris O'Rourke and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
This program looks at three different work environments, an apple orchard a timber yard and a children’s animal farm. We see the people who work there, find out what each job entails and the process used to accomplish the various tasks involved.

results.title: The Firefighter, Police helicopter, Police officer
results.creator_credit: James Mann, Chris O'Rourke and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
Shows the work done by a firefighter, by policemen who man the police helicopter and the work of a various police officers from senior sargents to motor cycle police. The duties and responsibilities of each profession and the necessary equipment and supplies required by each person in order to get the job done.

results.title: At the supermarket
results.creator_credit: David Hughes and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
Non-narrated. Shows us some of the people who help run a supermarket. Apart from the familiar helpers such as checkout cashiers, and sales assistants we also see people who prepare meat and vegetables for sale, those who order and take delivery of stock and night fillers.

results.title: The Nurse; the vet; the ambulance
results.creator_credit: James Mann, Chris O'Rourke and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
A composite tape showing three short programs which give profiles of occupations which help to keep us safe and healthy. On this tape a nurse, a vet and an ambulance driver give insights into their daily duties.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Mann, Chris O’Rourke and TV Ed Productions

results.title: Reading planet
results.creator_credit: Pawel Kuczynski, Study Sources Unlimited and H G Simons Productions
results.brief_description: Prism a young alien from the planet Reading is given the task of improving the reading skills of five earth students. Through their various adventures the audience is introduced to techniques such as deriving meaning from context, visualisation, etc.

results.title: Time scrambler
results.creator_credit: Pawel Kuczynski, Henriette Simons, Landmark Films and H Simons
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading planet”.
The Time Scrambler has locked five students into a lost time frame. Designed to teach students to use a time line and to recognise sequencing cues in the reading selections. Tells how Prism, an 11 year old alien/teacher instructs his earth students in time sequence when the students become confused about the sequence of events in a story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pawel Kuczynski, Henriette Simons, Landmark Films and H Simons

results.title: Turn on the TV in your head
results.creator_credit: Pawel Kuczynski, Study Sources Unlimited and H G Simons Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading planet”.
Prism, a young alien from the planet Reading, is sent to earth to help five students improve their reading skills. With magical powers he transports them to outer space where he teaches them the importance of concentration and the process of visualisation. With practice the students discover that words can activate the formation of mental pictures. Reading becomes fun when they “turn on the TV in their minds”.

results.title: Hope of the future: inferences in reading
results.creator_credit: Pawel Kuczynski, Study Sources Unlimited and H G Simons Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading planet”.
Prism, a young alien from the planet Reading, is sent to Earth to help five students improve their reading skills. Queen Zoria wants to assign Prism to another planet. The only way he can stay with his Earth friends is to prove that these students understand implied relationships and can read between and beyond the words. In an intense confrontation with Queen Zoria, the students prove their ability to understand inferences. She is so impressed with their excellent comprehension that Prism is permitted to continue his task of developing good readers.
